modName: Simple Vanilla armor to HDT armor tutorial
summary:
Just a simple way to get a turn a non-tbbp/bbp/hdt armor into a HDT armor.
Total time is just under 5 min. If you have the right files.
descriptionHtml:
This is a tutorial on how to turn a vanilla armor into a HDT armor. (Breast and Butt only)

This will NOT turn an A cup armor into a (D,DD,E,F,G or J cup) armor/jiggle monster.
If you want to change the cup/breast size of the armor to fit the base HDT body you need to do it in between step 7 and 8. I have not done it before so I'm not sure how to.

You will need
   HDT physics extension and all required mods for it to work installed.
   .nif file of the armor you want to convert
   Caliente's Bodyslide 2 with Outfit Studio
   Nexus MM , Mod Organizer or other mod installer/manger

I made a video and put it in a .zip file in the Files section for those of you who need to see it done. (like me)
It took longer to upload this file than it did to convert 3+ armors.
Whole process takes less than 5 min. once you've done it a few times.

1. You need a .nif mesh file for the armor you want to convert. (exp: bikini_1.nif)
2. You need to make sure you have the HDT physics extension mod/mods installed or it will not work.
3. Open Bodyslide2 ->Outfit Studio-File->New Project
4. Under (use template) select the HDT body preset of your choice that comes with Bodyslide2 (I use CBBE body HDT)
5. Click (NEXT) then name the outfit. (not sure if it matters what you name it)
6. Under (Load from .nif file) choose your vanilla armor .nif mesh.  (I'm pretty sure you need the _1.nif  Exp: bikini_1.nif from the mesh dir.)
7. Choose (FINISH) without changing anything else.
    The armor most likely will not look right (boobs/calfs poking out of armor)if the body/armor doesn't match.

 ### 7.5 Check to see if you have any pieces of armor that are grossly out of place. (exp: Floating 10 feet up or backwards.)  If you do select the piece
       and use the scale shape, move shape, and rotate shape options to move the piece back into place. (this step is not in the video) ###
       *** I had an issue with an armor set being a major SNAFU before I added HDT.  (Look at pictures section for how I fixed it.

8.  Under shapedata under mesh tab (shapedata\calientebody\calientebodyhdt.nif for me) select base shape and then select bones tab
9. Hold CTRL and select NPC L Breast, NPC L Butt, NPC R Breast, and NPC R Butt. (only Tbbp,bbp, and hdt bodies have these)
10.Select Mesh and then select everything under (new outfit for me) whatever you named your outfit. (I have baseshape_oufit,bikini,and armor)
11.Right click on the one of them and select (Copy selected weights)
12.Go to File->Export->Export Nif   and save in a Data/mesh/armor/armorname/female. (if you used BSA extract 2 or more files it will build if for you)
      (exp: mine is   Data/mesh/armor/masseffect/reckoner/female/bikini_1.nif
13.Go back to where the Data folder is and right click on Data ->send to->compressed zip file
14. Rename the .zip file to something so you know what is in their. (Mine is ME3reckonerHDT.zip)
15. Import the .zip file into your mod manager and activate it like any other mod.
      You need the original mod the armor came from unless your .zip file contains all the original mesh/texture and .esp files
16. Start Skyrim and equip your armor to see if it is now HDT.

Hope this works for you and helps.
I have HDT physics, tbbp animations (don't think you need them for HDT), xp32 skeleton, and CBBE body mesh/texture with HDT.
If it doe's not help... well im stumped because i figured it out by DUMB luck.
